column4: I installed network-manager-gnome, but accidentally removed the icon on my panel. Anyone know how to get it back? BTW, I'm not talking about the the network monitor that defaults to the panel.

if you know the command for network-manager-gnome, you should be able to create a launcher on the panel by right clicking on it and selecting add to panel then application launcher or custom application launcher
how do you access network-manager-gnome other than that launcher you had
it just resided in the panel as an icon when I installed it
did this thing on the panel move and do stuff or just sit idly until you clicked on it
do gnome-nettool, and see if what it launches is what you are talking about
I don't have a laptop nor wireless connectivity, hence no knowledge
I have no idea how it started
maybe it is an applet you are talking about, right click on the panel then scroll all the way down and see if it is there
can you at least tell if it is an applet or launcher that you were used to clicking on

it is hard to know if that is a launcher or applet, seems unlikely that a launcher would be made for you with an install so if I had to guess i would say applet, but if it is an applet you should be able to add it through that right click add to panel dialog
you could try uninstalling and then reinstalling, maybe it will do it again for you. But you probably should figure out why it works and that way you can at least put it back if it goes away
you are absolutely sure it isn't network monitor?
when you click on it it gives you an option to do just what you were talking about or at least it appears to. I don't have two connections to test it
when you do reinstall try to figure out how it works
